bug.author: omartin2010
bug.summary: Attrubutes section looks like it's missing the name of the attributes
bug.description:
We see this : <denchmark-code>Attributes DEPRECATED. Azure automatically detects and uses the NVIDIA Docker extension when it is available. </denchmark-code>
but this doesn't tell us which attribute is deprecated. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: f74ef100-d06b-b9c5-bbfb-78120ee794c5 Version Independent ID: a0fdc0b6-3d00-2886-895f-7aa502aab668 Content: azureml.core.environment.DockerSection class - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML-Docset/stable/docs-ref-autogen/azureml-core/azureml.core.environment.DockerSection.yml Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @j-martens Microsoft Alias: jmartens

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/omartin2010>@omartin2010</denchmark-link> we will review your feedback and get back to you shortly. Thanks.
Thanks. Something is broken in the build so that Attribute names are not showing up. We are investigating.
Attribute names are back - in this case indicating what was deprecated. Thanks.
Thanks for your report. It was helpful to identify quickly. We will now proceed to close this thread.
